dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 3, pp. 28-36. Describes her sheltered childhood and her voluminous reading. After being baptized in the Episcopalian Church and loving the services she disavows organized religion as her sense of social justice developles.
